column1: Gwaihir was the greatest and the swiftest of the Eagles of Middle-earth at the time of the War of the Ring.

column2: it is said that Gwaihir was his vassal in the First Age and
column4: helped rescue Beren and Lúthien from Angband. p. 68 In the Third Age he was the greatest and the swiftest of the Eagles of the North.

column1: During the War of the Ring
column2: Radagast sought help of his old friends. The Eagles set off and gathered news: wolves and Orcs gathering and mustering
column4: and the escape of Gollum from Mirkwood.

column2: Radagast sent Gwaihir to bear the news to him at Isengard
column3: but Gandalf was at that time imprisoned at the pinnacle of Orthanc. On an autumn night
column4: Gandalf saw the Eagle flying towards him and so Gwaihir rescued the Wizard. But Gwaihir couldnt carry him far
column5: so Gwaihir left him at Edoras in order to find a steed.

column1: Later he was sent by Galadriel to find Gandalf; he found him on the peak of Celebdil after the Battle of the Peak

column2: Meneldor and Landroval helped the Free peoples in the Battle of the Morannon; in the aftermath
column3: they brought Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee out of Mordor after the One Ring was destroyed.

column2: pp. 33-4 and possibly hîr "lord".  His name could thus likely be translated as "Windlord".

column3: "Gwaewar" and "Lhandroval") appeared in early The Silmarillion
column4: as vassals of Thorondor who helped to bear Beren and Lúthien from Angband. These references were removed by Christopher Tolkien to escape the seeming discrepancy with The Lord of the Rings
column5: although later he admitted that he was not sure about his fathers intentions. Chs. 12–15

column1: It is generally thought that Gwaihir is the Lord of the Eagles of The Hobbit
column2: although J.R.R. Tolkien never makes a connection nor mentions that Gwaihir was Lord of the Eagles. This notion is also seen in Robert Fosters The Complete Guide to Middle-earth.

column1: In the whole Lord of the Rings Gwaihir carries Gandalf twice
column2: and by the end of the book Gandalf says that Gwaihir had carried him twice; this implies that Gwaihir never carried him before the timeframe of the book.

column1: 2001: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring:
:Gandalf whispers "Gwaihir" repeatedly to a Moths that arrives at Isengard. Later
2003: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King:
:Gwaihir and his Eagles come to aid at the Battle of the Morannon. They attack the Nazgûl and their fell beasts. After the battle is won and the One Ring destroyed
column2: Gwaihir along with Gandalf and a second Eagle rescue Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee from the rocks of Mount Doom.

column1: 1981: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series):
:Alexander John provided the voice of Gwaihir during Gandalfs rescue from Orthanc.
2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:
:Gwaihir is first mentioned by Gandalf when the player meets up with him at the Prancing Pony.
column2: Foreword: "Aiding the Order" The player first sees Gwaihir when entering Galadriels garden in Lothlórien for the first time.

column1: 2011: The Lord of the Rings: War in the North:

column2: in which Beleram tells that he has been sent by Gwaihir to gather news. Later on in the game
column3: he makes a full appearance.The Lord of the Rings: War in the North
